basics.name: Nick Vigilante
basics.label: Documentation Architect/Software Engineer
basics.summary: I like to write docs and code stuff. I have a proven track record of improving docs systems and automating processes. I'm always looking for new opportunities to learn new skills in technical writing and software engineering.

work.name: MicroStrategy, Inc
work.summary: Provider of enterprise-level phone and email support and supplier of knowledge base articles on the MicroStrategy platform
highlights: Provided complex and challenging support for MicroStrategy's Business Intelligence product suite and its underlying technologies
Developed strong relationships with MicroStrategy customers and partners through daily interactions during customer project development and production system maintenance
Found creative and sophisticated solutions to problems reported while using MicroStrategy's product suite through analytical talent and strong troubleshooting abilities
Worked in a strong team environment to provide unparalleled support to customers in a wide variety of industries
Prioritized and communicated product defects and enhancements to development teams
Contributed to research and growth of the MicroStrategy Knowledge Base by creating customer-facing documentation of all technical solutions and product documentation addenda

work.name: MicroStrategy, Inc
work.summary: Subject matter expert for technical support engineers and supplier of knowledge base articles on the MicroStrategy platform
highlights: Contributed to research and growth of the MicroStrategy Knowledge Base by creating customer-facing documentation of all technical solutions and product documentation addenda
Worked as a product expert who solved the most difficult technical cases and defused critical customer situations

Used well-developed technical and customer management skills, along with the ability to interact well with the QEs and software developers and involvement with internal Cloud infrastructure, to provide support for MicroStrategy's customers
Specialized in database-related issues as well as mobile application-related issues
Provided training to members of the department to further enhance knowledge of other engineers

work.name: Appian Corporation
work.summary: Knowledge Base architect, subject matter expert, Appian developer, and cloud infrastructure support engineer
highlights: Analyzed customer log data to track trends in usage and identify problems within the Appian platform
Created and maintained product knowledge base, contributing over 200 articles on product issues, how-to guides, best practices, and troubleshooting common issues
Submitted updates to the product documentation adhering to the Microsoft style guide
Administered and developed on customer-facing and employee-facing systems, including a complete overhaul of product licensing application
Collaborated with engineering and cloud teams to share product pain points, high-profile code issues, and product enhancements
Managed a team of engineers focused on application design and end-user interface concepts
Provided expert-level assistance and application design recommendations to customers, partners, and fellow employees
Liaised with premium support customers on a regular basis to offer guidance, preventative maintenance, and strategic suggestions to maximize the value of the platform

work.name: AFAK Solutions, LLC
highlights: Provided hardware and software infrastructure support for and upgrades to existing systems
Performed content structural review and enhancements of existing slide decks and course material for professional development training

work.name: TCT, Inc
work.summary: Developed full-stack SQL-based compensation management applications in the beqom platform for clients in the financial services industry
highlights: Created and modified stored procedures, functions, tables, views, and other database objects to support new business requirements, in addition to making various database customizations, to support SQL-based compensation management applications
Worked closely with regulatory teams and project management to gather requirements and develop applications and test cases that match expected compensation values from older compensation systems
Created and delivered both documentation and training for and offered mentorship to end users and fellow employees on various parts of the beqom platform
Liaised with vendor product and roadmap teams to communicate product improvements and client issues/pain points
Operated and developed in both Agile and DevOps methodologies

work.name: Cockroach Labs
highlights: Wrote and maintained CockroachDB documentation, collaborating with engineering teams to document new features, schema updates, and data migrations
Submitted regular release notes to highlight product changes across releases
Reviewed Jira, Slack, and other data sources to drive improvements to the documentation

Enhanced internal tooling and documentation surrounding release note generation to reduce writer toil for generating release notes and improve user experience when reading release notes by combining releases for a single version onto a single page

work.name: Cockroach Labs
work.summary: Maintained and enhanced the infrastructure surrounding CRL's product documentation
highlights: Improved UX and SEO of product documentation site by way of structured data modifications, link standardization, and various enhancements to testing and linting tools
Created and modified Go and Python code responsible for process and content automation, data governance of docs repo, and git commit message compliance
Reduced toil for managers triaging issues by automatically associating work items with Jira epics
Delivered frequent internal documentation updates and training seminars to the documentation team to help bolster existing skills and improve their productivity
Orchestrated enterprise software trials for various hosting platforms to improve site availability and reduce site build times by over 35%
Improved search experience by bringing end users to their desired content quicker and more reliably through Algolia
Provided tooling assistance to writers to ensure a frictionless contribution experience
Reviewed Jira, Slack, and other data sources to drive improvements to the documentation

work.name: TileDB, Inc.
work.summary: Sole technical writer managing TileDB's documentation, including strategy, governance, and infrastructure
highlights: Led the complete rebuild of TileDB's documentation, culminating in TileDB Academy, a comprehensive educational resource
Developed tutorials, foundational content, and reference materials for the TileDB commercial platform and its subproducts, improving user adoption and onboarding
Collaborated with engineers and product managers to strategically plan and publish new technical content, ensuring alignment with product development
Established and enforced an exhaustive style guide based on industry standards from Microsoft, Google, and Red Hat, standardizing documentation quality
Led cross-functional documentation initiatives, aligning content strategy with Engineering, Sales, and Marketing, resulting in improved documentation accessibility and internal efficiency
Designed and implemented a suite of code and style linters, including Vale, Ruff, ESLint, and Prettier, along with custom Python-based fixers, ensuring high-quality, consistent documentation and code
Conducted company-wide training sessions on the documentation contribution process, best practices, and style standards, improving internal documentation quality and consistency
Contributed directly to TileDB's open-source APIs, enhancing documentation and code accuracy through hands-on development
Performed regular QA testing of TileDB's API clients, reporting bugs and feature requests to Engineering to improve product stability and user experience

volunteer.summary: Co-chair of the LGBTQIA+ employee resource group dedicated to helping employees with LGBTQIA+ friends and loved ones as well as LGBTQIA+ employees
highlights: Hosted virtual and in-person company-wide happy hours
Co-hosted a volunteer event to pack snack packs; donated said snack packs to the Ali Forney Center in NYC to benefit LGBTQIA+ youth experiencing food insecurity
Oversaw a committee of volunteers who contributed blog posts, created company swag, and led various events for the company

courses: Art and Science of Mathematics I
